body: Thanks, Theodore! I didn't open ParaView from within OF, i.e., I opened it by double click the ParaView thumbnail, and then did the following: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/H9E9iJBHqZPOCSMaTWyydbWrc6cengGf9B4kURQCoDq57y8MD-LxK5QQfv2mEb5WAzw3uof0hxUkznHOC1OFG3tlKr4mNtRd/Image1.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/H9E9iJBHqZMVy1p3skfDUR7PMx5-SB1tkYbgd7hNQOovHz1rz7YDxabXNwA9MZ4xNmlQ8gOBebhz6euV9HnkCIy3YSUjybMy/Image2.png)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/H9E9iJBHqZOFuopiepvK7CdVA4LEHVLukLixXz2m1Eobr6ukf4tpu44-s5bTFHvnR9FJRVg-R2BzQqp4Eaqh482VX81dS*bm/Image3.png) I shall try increasing the meshing parameter as suggested. The visualization of U magnitude by point as suggested is shown below which might be improved if the meshing resolution is higher: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/H9E9iJBHqZNI1-EPAsrVApwjNVLp391C*IKj48A4yHxpzCbhtemEEQxivocjqnjKb*NBb5QwGkKyX2fX3XbfuDrbH6zPFB5l/Image5.png) Thank you very much, again, for your detailed advice!
